name: Marriott Niagara Falls Gateway on the Falls Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I used to stay here when it was a Sheraton because we liked it more than some other hotels that we visited in the Falls. We found the hotel to be even better now that it is a Marriott. There have been some changes to the lobby and lounge area that are very nice. The staff was very polished and friendly. We were upgraded to a two story suite that was very spacious, clean, and well-appointed. We ordered room service a couple of times, and found the food to be very good quality and was delivered in a very timely manner. In conclusion, I enjoyed my stay at the Marriott Gateway on the Falls and would recommend it to anyone considering a visit to Niagara Falls.
reviews.title: Back to the Marriott Gateway on the Falls

reviews.text: Beautiful view of the falls! Hotel is nice, modern and very clean. Definitely go for a Superior room with the floor to ceiling window. If it's not cloudy, be it summer or winter set your alarm clock to watch the sunrise over the river and falls. Totally worth it even after a long night, it is a unique experience. Just check the local sunrise time the night before:)
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel for a weekend getaway that makes for a memorable experience!

reviews.text: Friendly staff and prompt service. We asked for a feather free room and a team came over shortly and changed everything in a couple of minutes.
reviews.title: My stay at Mariott

reviews.text: I could mention always riding in the elevator with staff pushing cleaning carts or laundry carts but it is absolutely irrelevant The hotel is beautiful and it is in a spot where anybody in this world would want to be at least once in their lifetime!
reviews.title: What a View!

reviews.text: My sons and me stayed for one night in Mariott hotel.Overall it was a pleasant experience.Staff at the desk was friendly.We were able to check-in at 0730 am.Room was clean,it has a fridge but no microwave.Bed was comfortable and clean.Bathroom was small but clean,only the bathtub was clogged a little,that water did not go down right away.We have a two queen room with a city view.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to Niagara Falls for the first time for a conference. They put me up in this hotel. Nice hotel, nice room but it was dark when I arrived. The next morning, I opened the drapes to the knock-your-socks-off view of the Falls directly across the street. Wowza! And it's right across the street from the Convention Center so the location is really ideal for business.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.text: We chose the Sheraton Fallsview after reading reviews on this forum, and were very pleased that we did. It is in a superb, quiet location, right by the Horseshoe Falls.
reviews.title: Sheraton Fallsview was perfect

reviews.text: Check in was quick and efficient, and we were absolutely amazed by the view from our room on the 31st floor. We had a family suite (one room with two double beds, one with a king, two bathrooms, one with whirlpool bath) with floor to ceiling windows with unobstructed views of both the American and Horseshoe Falls. Absolutely perfect. Rooms were spotlessly clean, and the beds extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Don't go over March break

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was very good, with the same lovely views over the falls from the dining room. We had no problems whatsoever - friendly staff, lovely accommodation, quick lifts, good food.
reviews.title: Pretty good time!!

reviews.text: We would definitely stay at the Sheraton Fallsview again.
reviews.title: Outstanding!!

reviews.text: Couldn't wait to get there, couldn't wait to leave. Don't go over March Break! It was packed! The pool was closed 2pm-4pm, for regular cleaning. This was despite the fact that I was told, come anytime, it's open until 10pm. When it did open, there was a 1 1/2 to 2 hour wait to get in, because all the kids/families had been waiting for so long. The elevators were beyond slow...everyone was taking the stairs instead, after waiting 10-15 minutes for the elevators. If you got an elevator, we all talked about how unorganized the hotel was, and how they ABSOLUTELY can not perform at full capacity. The staff was useless and no help at all, especially at the "events" they had lined up for the kids. Anything FREE was packed and totally disorganized. If you had to pay, it was WAY overpriced. The rooms were clean and had a beautiful view. Anything we did, that was fun, was outside this hotel. DON'T get trapped into going next door at Denny's, I found out later that it's the MOST EXPENSIVE Denny's in all of North America! Seriously, unless you like paying almost $14 (w/o tip) for bacon and eggs only. I am a local...and would definately NOT recommend this site during any peak time.
reviews.title: Wow...
We Loved Wine Country!
reviews.text: My husband booked a two-day package for us from Feb. 27- Mar. 1 at the Sheraton Fallsview Hotel & Conference Center. The package included a Deluxe Fallsview Room, two vouchers for a full buffet breakfast, a $50 voucher towards one meal at A Cut Above Steakhouse, and a tour of 4 wineries in the area. When my husband made the reservation, he was informed that there were no Deluxe rooms available, but they could upgrade us to a room with a fireplace and two-person jacuzzi. I was a bit surprised upon arriving at the hotel that there did not seem to be very many people staying in the hotel at all, however we did notice on our bill that the upgrade was provided at no extra charge.

reviews.title: Loved the beds!
reviews.text: Upon arriving, we did notice that the hotel was undergoing extensive rennovations, which we were not informed of when we made our reservations. This did not bother my husband and I, but be advised that there were several spots where tripping may be a hazard if one is not careful. Check-in was swift, we paid $10 a day for parking, and there was also covered parking available which was handy since it snowed most of our time there.

reviews.title: More 2 Come
reviews.text: Our room was on the 26th floor, and the elevator ride was fairly quick. However, once we arrived at our room, the keycards didn't work in the door, so my husband had to go all the way back down to the front desk to have them fixed. He came back up and we tried again...and they still didn't work. By this time we had discovered there was a phone in the hallway and this time we called the front desk, who sent someone to fix the doors. 10 minutes later, we were in our room.

The room was nice, magnificent view of the falls, and had a small living room with a TV, fireplace, and sofabed. It had a separate bedroom with another TV and king-size bed. The bathroom was enormous and had a glassed-in shower and two-person jacuzzi tub surrounded by mirrors. I was very impressed with the complimentary bath products, they were good quality and they even supplied us with bubble bath to use in the tub! I was also impressed that we were provided with a complimentary sewing kit, which came in handy as i had to sew a button back on my pants during our stay! The room was very clean, however, the second day I dropped something under the bathroom counter, and was a bit appalled by the dust under the vanity. It was apparent that housekeeping was overlooking this area during their cleaning.
reviews.title: Don said it was better than Horseshoe!
Frequent Visitors, Surprised Lobby Renovations
reviews.text: Our first night there, we ate at the Cut Above Steakhouse, where we dined with a breathtaking view of the falls. I ate the Prime Rib, and my husband had a steak, and I had to say that my meat was fabulous but the Yorkshire Pudding was very salty and dense, obviously frozen or instant product. With our $50 dinner voucher we still spent an additional $70 on dinner (tip included), so it is fairly expensive but we didn't mind so much. After dinner we wanted to venture to the Casino, and were disappointed to discover there was no shuttle service even though the Mariott next door was providing the service. We decided we would walk, and it was VERY cold. We still had an enjoyable time at the casino, there was live entertainment and the casino was not busy at all (nor was any place there at this time of year!) After our chilly walk back from the casino, we stopped into Stanley's pub (on the first floor of the hotel) and had a nightcap. The bartender was young, not very friendly, and spent the entire time chatting with his buddies at the end of the bar. Not very professional, in our opinion.

reviews.text: Something very nice is that the wego (the shuttle that goes around all the city) stops just in front of the hotel! Is great to catch it there and have you drop off again in the same place!
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.text: We have spent two nights on a week end. Nice, clean hotel. Good that they have Milestones restaurant on-site. I like their spacious lobby lounge. The only small down-side (especially you feel it winter) is that it is at a 10 min walk distance from the Fallsview casino.
reviews.title: Nice for a week-end get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luxury. Every room has a view of the Falls. The staff is attentive and interested in meeting your needs. We had a room on the top floor. There was a fireplace in the room (gas, so needed no attention). We were given open access to the cafe there. Close to absolutely everything. Valet parking. Beautiful room - the room had windows that reached from floor to ceiling revealing the Falls. Perfect. When I return, it will be there. We had a visual of all the Falls light shows. Every room has a view of the Falls from what I saw.
reviews.title: You don't need to be on a honeymood to visit Niagra Falls.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved it! One of the better places we have stayed. The rooms were beautiful, clean, and had everything we needed. The view was fantastic - right overlooking the falls. We have stayed at this hotel 3 times and have never been disappointed. The in-house Milestone restaurant is superb for evening dining and the amazing breakfast buffet is a standard way above most hotel breakfasts. Our son just recently went upon our recommendation, and he was as satisfied as we were. The service and accommodations were top-notch. We definitely will go again and recommend it to our friends.

My wife and I have been returning to the Sheraton Fallsview once a year since the late '90s because we think it is the best hotel in Niagara Falls. We typically go for the jacuzzi fallsview room, but this time we tried the fallsview suite. The difference between the regular jacuzzi room and the suite is the sitting area with a fireplace that is separate from the bedroom. Also, the shower and the bathroom are bigger. We were on the 26th floor, and as you can see from the attached photos, the view of the Falls was unobstructed and excellent. The rooms are always sparkling clean and well appointed. They have several dining choices, including pub fare and an upscale steakhouse, in addition to an extensive room service menu should you wish to stay put and take in the views. They are currently finishing up a renovation project in the lobby area, but even before that the place was beautiful. The hotel is outside of the Clifton Hill tourist area, but is within walking distance (for most). Otherwise, I think they run shuttles to the Casino. There is also a new Casino a few blocks from the hotel, and there are several restaurants nearby. In short, the Sheraton Fallsview is consistently excellent and we will continue to return.
reviews.title: As Usual, the Sheraton Fallsview is Excellent
My favourite Niagara hotel
reviews.text: We've been to the fallsview several times, it's our usual stop in Niagara Falls. The hotel restaurant has great food and ambience, and we don't even need to leave the hotel. It's immaculate and the staff are great. You can watch the falls on closed circuit TV from any room, no need to upgrade to a fallsview room. If you're there when there are fireworks scheduled, get a fallsview room, it's a great show. A little pricey during peak times, but a great deal off season (we usually go before Christmas).

reviews.title: WOW what a place!!
reviews.text: Wow!! was all we said for about half an hour after arriving in our room on the 27th floor. We booked a fallsview 2 bed family suite and it was worth every penny. The kids had a kingsize bed each and own bathroom and we had a seperate bedroom with a huge bed & large bathroom with jacuzzi what more could you want. Both rooms overlooked the stunning falls. Before we went I read some reviews about how far it was to walk from the hotel to the falls... well I'm sorry but those folks must just be a bit lazy because it was only a ten minute stroll walking through the lovely casino grounds. Lots of restaurants in easy reach, staff great.. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

I booked into the Sheraton based upon the reviews on this site. My room was nice, but unfortunately, I need internet access to do my job. First they sent up a tech and we got wireless to function barely (connection showed two red bars). He came by again to drop off a cable for the wired connect. The wired connection didn't work. I then requested that I be moved to another room. The other room had exactly the same situation. Basically, I arrived, had a late lunch in their pub, spent 1.5 hours trying to get the internet to work (it did barely and kept throwing me off), went for a walk in frustration and then checked out. For this, they charged me a $50 "day use" fee. I told them I had received no value from the room outside of several hours of frustration that their internet didn't work. I also told them I would immediately write a negative review and post it. The desk manager said she could not overrule the manager Paul and "he was busy." Rather than waste more of my time, I paid the $50 and walked across the street to the Marriott. They upgraded me to a much nicer room than I had at the Sheraton (which appears to be a much older property) and they charged me $40 less for the room. The internet connection at the Marriott works fine. The Sheraton seems like a nice place to stay as long as you don't have any need for the web or expect them to be customer focused in solving problems. The Marriott also has a much better view of the falls.
reviews.title: Internet connection doesn't work, management unfriendly
Loved the view but......
reviews.text: I was thinking of returning to the Niagara area this Summer and was debating on staying at the Sheraton Fallsview. I stayed here last year and would give the room, amenities and the view a very high rating. I was reading a comment from another reviewer concerning noise from fellow guests which they found annoying and thought I'd add my experience.

reviews.title: Great Place, Don't Believe the Negative.
reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights and it was perfect. I have stayed at many hotels (about a 100+ days a year) and this is diffentley a 4 Diamond Place. My room came with a fridge, safe, shampoo, lotion, and a beutiful view of Niagara Falls. Floor to Floor Windows. CLean Room. The bathtub did have scratches but all Hotels do. THe staff went out of there to make my stay enjoyable. Don't believe the last review because it is not true.

reviews.title: This is NO 4 Star!
reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on the reviews we read and can tell you we were horribly disappointed! Perhaps a lot of the guests to this hotel don't travel a lot? Being a Sheraton property and a 4 star I would have expected so much more. We stayed in a room on floor 31 overlooking the falls .. the view was spectacular, unfortunately I cannot say the same for the room. It was ok. The ensuite bathroom was clean, but what I'd expect from a Comfort Inn; certainly nothing luxurious. They could have fixed the scratched up bathtub and the mouldy caulking in this obviously older room.

Having travelled extensively, I can tell you that the staff here need to get a reality check on customer service, in many cases they were either just not interested or bording on being rude. When we asked about transportation to the casino the lady at the front desk pointed to the front door and suggested we follow the sidewalk. Keep in mind it's -15 outside. When we asked about a shuttle, she asked if we'd heard of taxis.
reviews.title: The best Sheraton in Niagara Falls

reviews.text: When we booked the hotel, albeit last minute, we indicated that we wanted a romantic weekend away as we were leaving the kids behind. No problem they booked us a room. They didn't mention however that the entire hockey league of out of control 10 year olds would be occupying the entire hotel all weekend, running up and down the halls at 6am, riding the elevators and screaming, or simply pushing all the buttons and hopping out. Hotel staff seemed not to care and certainly made no effort to do anything about it.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel - Read This Review
Great Experience
reviews.text: With a hotel in the core of Niagara Falls, one would have expected some sort of entertainment within the hotel itself, or at least promoting something nearby .. you're just left to fend for yourself.

aka: Marriott Gateway On The Falls Hotel
description: The Marriott Niagara Falls Hotel Gateway on the Falls is the ideal place to stay for your next leisure getaway. Aptly named, the hotel serves as a "gateway" to all of Niagara, and its recent $15-million renovation and upgrade offers our Niagara Falls hotel guests a modern and trendy travel experience. For guests looking to experience the best that a Niagara Falls hotel has to offer, the Marriott Gateway Niagara Falls hotel is situated in the heart of the Fallsview Boulevard district, minutes away from area attractions, world-class wineries, golf and casinos.
